intro: Paraspalathus callosa, commonly known as the rough-leafed spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in small, raised bumps. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in a structure called a cyathium. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Paraspalathus callosa is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
